name: Hindu Pushup
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a plank position on your hands and feet, with your hands shoulder-width apart and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Instead of lowering your chest towards the ground as you would in a traditional pushup, start by bringing one knee toward your torso and extending it toward the ceiling while keeping the other foot extended back.
3. Quickly switch the position of your legs, bringing the knee that was just lifted toward the ground and extending the previously stationary leg toward the ceiling.
4. Continue alternating legs quickly while maintaining a controlled core engagement throughout the exercise.
short_summary: The Hindu pushup is an abdominal exercise that involves moving one knee towards the chest while keeping the other foot extended back, mimicking the motion of running or cycling.
